No. 5

Pioneer Recreation and Social Life.

Please print name and address in capital letters.

Your full name ____________________________

Present Address ____________________________

Pioneer Address ____________________________

Year you came to Saskatchewan (Throughout the questionnaire, "Saskatchewan" means the area which is now Saskatchewan)

PLEASE NOTE

This questionnaire is intended for persons who came to Saskatchewan before 1924, and most of the questions are about that early period, although in a few questions information for later years is asked for. If you cannot answer a question, leave the space blank. We realize that any one person will not be able to answer all questions, so answer those that apply to your experience and that you can remember, and leave the others.

Use extra sheets of paper if there is not enough space on the questionnaire.

Your cooperation in answering this questionnaire will be very much appreciated, and all questionnaires are preserved in the Saskatchewan Archives as part of the permanent record of our province.

Please send your completed questionnaire to:

Saskatchewan Archives Office,
University of Saskatchewan,
Saskatoon, Sask.
SASKATCHEWAN ARCHIVES QUESTIONNAIRES.

NO. 5

Pioneer Recreation and Social Life.

NEIGHBORLY VISITING, PARTIES, ETC.

1. In the first few years how many homes were near enough to you for visiting back and forth? 6

How many of these were bachelor's homes? None.

2. How often did you usually visit neighbors? Perhaps ten times a year.

3. Did you usually visit on a Sunday, or other days? Usually on Sundays.

4. Were you often invited to other homes, or was most visiting done without an invitation? Without invitation for a purpose during an afternoon.

What time of the day did you go, in the morning and spend the day, or in the afternoon, etc.? P.M.

That about meals? Did you stay when not invited beforehand?

Sometimes, and it may have been the invitation to a meal served when people had come unexpectedly? (That is, was this term to "stay politely used," or was some other expression common?)

If no meal, what other refreshment might be offered to visitors who had dropped in?

5. Did the whole family go, or did someone stay home to "look after the place"? None as a family—just one or two of our family at times.

6. Did you ever have "bees" when groups of neighbors came together to put up a building, make quilts, or other such activity? No

Tell what you remember about such gatherings, giving dates if possible, telling what the "bees" were for, and how often they occurred.

7. In the earliest years that you were here, were there many parties, whilst drives or dances in homes? Describe.

Yes they were—but personally did not attend them.

a few parties, for the children seen kindly parents.

Were these more frequent in later years? Give dates.

Did you follow any kind of informal schedule, such as going by turn from one home to another at definite times, every two weeks, once a month, etc.?
